data.title: History Grand Lodge Mark Masons by John Grantham, Used
data.meta_description: History of the grand lodge of mark masons of England and Wales and the dominions and dependencies of the British Crown; by John A Grantham and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Condition: Good. 1960. No Edition Remarks. 248 pages. White dust jacket over red cloth and gilt lettering. Contains black and white photographic plates. Boards have light edge-wear with slight rubbing to surfaces and spine is presentable with minimal crushing and tanning. Unclipped jacket. Jacket has heavy edge-wear with some areas of loss, heavy tears, chips and creasing. Moderate tanning to jacket spine and edges.

Signed first and limited edition. Small label laid-down to front endpaper: "This issue is limited to 800 copies each of which was to have been signed by the author. Owing to V.W.Bro. Grantham's untimely death, however, a facsimile signature is substituted. Copy No 26". From the founding of the Grand Mark Lodge in 1856 to the centenary in 1956. Pp.xvi/264, 12 black & white plates to end. Clean text throughout. Blue cloth, gilt title to spine, edges slightly rubbed. Grey dustwrapper with printed title and blue decorated border, with small chips and tears, now protected by a removeable clear plastic cover. VG/G+.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. Blue cloth hard covers in tidy condition with a chipped and browned dust jacket, previous owners name and date, number 216 from a limited edition of 800, signed by the author Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall. Signed By The Author.

HB. Condition: VG. Dust Jacket Condition: VG. First Edition. Clean red cloth on boards with gilt titles. Soft rubbing to foot of spine and to bottom boards edges. Edges: light foxings. Ffep: signature 29th February 1960. Clean contents. Binding is As New. 264p Dj: clean jacket. Spine: very light yellowing. Rear top -edge with small open piece missing.

Near fine copy in the original title-blocked cloth. Spine bands and panel edges very slightly dust-toned as with age. Remains particularly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, clean and strong. Physical description; 264 pages : illustrations ; 22 cm. Notes; Includes bibliographical references and index. Subjects; Freemasons. Grand Lodge of Mark Master Masons of England and Wales and its Districts and Lodges Overseas. History. Mark Masonry England. 1 Kg.

Near fine copy in the original title-blocked cloth. Spine bands and panel edges very slightly dust-toned as with age. Remains particularly well-preserved overall; tight, bright, clean and strong. Physical description; 264 pages : illustrations ; 22 cm. Notes; Includes bibliographical references and index. Subjects; Freemasons. Grand Lodge of Mark Master Masons of England and Wales and its Districts and Lodges Overseas. History. Mark Masonry England. 1 Kg.
